Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a posh friends house!”
Reviews.Author: RobinSuffolk_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel, furnished with quality antiques, real paintings, clean smart new bathrooms, and fairly quiet for so close to the centre.In a really good location for the metro (Tuilleries station about a 2 minute walk).The reception staff were all really friendly and helpful.There is no breakfast room, but the breakfast was fresh, delicious, and far better value than the rubbish one we got when we did decide to eat in one of the cafes nearbye

Reviews.Title: “Parisian elegance and a great location...”
Reviews.Author: GayeG
Reviews.Content: First time for this Aussie in Paris and friends recommended this gorgeous little hotel to me, with good reason. The setting is prestigious and the area is exclusive....easy walking distance to the Concorde, Palais de l'Elysee, Louvre, Orangerie, ALL the luxury boutiques of the faubourg and the rue Saint-Honore. The charming room was extremely clean and comfortable with WiFi, Sat TV, phone, fridge, A/C, trouser press and mini bar....the usuals... etc. We walked our feet down to our ankles and always felt welcome when returning. Staff were friendly and accommodating, especially necessary with my woeful attempts at French. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for a romantic tryst”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiredales14
Reviews.Content: As someone else has commented helpful staff count for a lot, and the staff here were all excellent. We arrived early (around 11am) and were able to go straight to our room. having practised our very basic French on the receptionist, who. despite having very good English herself, was kind enough to speak slowly in French, and to make the effort to understand us. Our room on the second floor was a little small ,as we expected, having read the reviews, but it was clean and well-presented. There was no kettle or tea/coffee though this might have been an oversight. When we asked for a kettle and cups we were provided with them. The bathroom was large, with a bath and a shower, which compensated for the smallness of the room, There was a little balcony, which was great for looking out over the street (and the school) but when we closed the balcony door the room was completely sound proofed. We had the hotel breakfast one day, and, and thought it reasonable value although, as other reviewers have commented, it was much more fun to eat in one of the many cafes within a very few minutes walk. On Sunday, fewer places are open, but still enough to have a choice of eateries. We were a bit anxious about finding some where open, but the receptionist sent us on our way, saying if we did not find anywhere we could change our minds and have breakfast in the hotel. Will definitely stay here whenever in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 3-star hotel, situated on a very quiet street in a central location. My room had recently been refurbished, the bathroom being of good 4-star quality, the size of the bedroom was larger than I expected (I think I had one of the larger rooms though). Small balcony onto main street, I only saw one or two cars pass by in two days. There is a school opposite, but I only heard children playing after 8am so was fine. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good, being a set menu of french bread, croissant, jam, cheese, coffee or hot chocolate or tea, plus you can order extras like eggs. Nearest Metro Madeleine only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I noticed they are refurbishing other rooms in the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful friendly staff, great for families”
Reviews.Author: sitilewa
Reviews.Content: A hotel can have all the fancy amenities, but helpful and friendly staff is the best attribute. We arrived very early on an overnight train from Toulouse, with two young children and 6 pieces of luggage. After a friendly greeting and efficient check in we were assured that our rooms would be provided in half an hour - and I don't think we even waited that long. We were so grateful as did not expect to have access 7hours prior to normal check in time. As a family, we had booked the 'family room'. We were on the 6th floor and at the end of the hall, there was a door that locked, so that you effectively closed off the end of the floor, and the two rooms at the end that faced each other, were ours. So we locked this door and left the two front doors of our rooms opened, so that we had a small passage between the rooms. It was a great option to an 'interconnecting room' which was impossible to find in Paris, and well priced at 314 Euros The rooms were a reasonable size, comfortable, very clean, and very quiet. Yes our room faced the street and onto the school, but there was no noise at all from it, other than some playground noise at one point, but what is there to complain about that. We had the window slightly ajar at night even though it was January to let in the cool night air, and there was no street noise that affected us. The mattress was wonderfully comfortable and beds cosy. The children's bathroom was bigger than ours and the shower more comfortable as ours had a slightly sloped ceiling over it (being on the top floor and what seemed an attic room). But our room had a little balcony which was charming. Hotel Alison is in a great location surrounded by fabulous food stores, cafes, and brasseries, with easy access to the metro and Champs-Elysees. Breakfast was generous with a large baguette, the lightest, freshest, warm croissants we'd had so far in the 5 weeks in France, yoghurt, juice and coffee, served by super friendly and polite staff, in a gorgeous old stone 'cellar' (I think it was 10 Euros). I would like to make special mention of the lady at the front desk who was on the morning shift the 3 mornings we were there. All staff spoke English, but this lady was particularly friendly and helpful and the one who was on shift when we arrived. I did not get her name, but she was a great asset to this hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Tony104
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Alison with my family while on a short break on Paris to celebrate a birthday. The location in the Madeleine is excellent and well served with restaurants and bars as well as easy reach of major sites. My room was comfortable and on a Saturday night the street outside was remarkably quiet for the centre of. Highley recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Probably deserves an 'Excellent'!”
Reviews.Author: zungazung
Reviews.Content: Easy, easy access to the major central sights of Paris, all within walking distance for those who want to potter and the area feels very safe for an evening/ late return. Excellent base for a weekend visit and if you are out and about (not that everything isn't clean, quiet, comfortable etc. when you're there). Yes, the front door is locked in the evening, but is opened almost immediately. All staff were lovely and helpful and friendly. Our room was street facing and there was absolutely no noise at all (disconcertingly quiet if you live in central London!). Small fridge, balcony, good bathroom. Those who need a lot of space in a room may be disappointed.. but really in comparison to other hotels in Paris, for price and location, really rather good..

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel right in the centre”
Reviews.Author: JosephODonoghue
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is it's location. It is on a really nice and quiet street, but it's right in the heart. Eglise de la Madeleine is just 2 minutes walk, and Place de Concorde is under 5 minutes walk. I think one of the best locations in Paris, if you have only a few days. The staff aren't very friendly, especially those on front desk. They gave us the impression that the breakfast was free saying "Your breakfast if at 8 til 11", but the breakfast staff were lovely and the dining room is in a nice old cellar. The rooms are fine, as far as Paris hotels go. You don't have any of loud nighttime traffic, which is a bonus. The bathrooms are nice, modern and clean. I'd stay here again, for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gantgaw
Reviews.Content: Got interested in the hotel because of its location and booked it after reading the reviews. Stayed there for one night in July. What a great hotel! Got a double with bath on 3rd floor. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I had trouble finding the underground parking garage near the hotel, and the receptionist was very patient with me in explaining the location. The room was very clean, and bathroom was surprisingly spacious (Roget&Gelet toiletteries were a nice surprise). The mini fridge was well-stocked with both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages (we didn't drink any because we were sure the prices would be very high, but nice to have handy in case). The room didn't have an iron, but had a trouser press. As we went in July, school was out and the elementary school noise wasn't an issue. Hotel is within walking distance to Galeries Lafayette (15 mins), Arc de Triomphe (25 mins). We came back late at night and felt very safe walking in the neighborhood. There is a small market a few doors down where you can buy drinks and snacks. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “unbelivable deals.....”
Reviews.Author: DUDETTE33
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying in Alison, and this time, we have the triple room on the 5th floor. Spectacular and bright room, we immediately felt like home. The location cannot be beat since it is just one block from American Embassy, French Presidential Palace, Salvatore Ferragamo, two blocks from Hermes (not that I shopped there), and many fancy shops. Did I mention that right across the street from the hotel is an elementary school. One day, we were woken up by the cheers of young children. How cute they are... I love this hotel, yes the elevator is quite small, but, I have no complaints. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisey and small bed!”
Reviews.Author: MAET2011
Reviews.Content: Very central location on a small back street but our room over looked a school so on Friday morning when we were looknig forward to not being woken by our children we were woken by 100's of screaming school kids! It is a noisey hotel but I guess that is what comes with being in such a central location. The rooms were clean and had everything you needed for a couple of nights but our bed was small but again I think this is what comes with staying in central paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and nice experience”
Reviews.Author: traveldizzy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Expedia and after reading reviews from Tripadvisor. This is a pleasant hotel with reasonable price. We stayed on the 4th floor, was given a spacious and clean non smoking room, which had everything you would need there. Yes it was big for Paris, can you believe it? :) Is it situated in walking distance to the Seine, Eiffel Tower, Champ E'lysees, Louvre, Hausmann, Hard Rock Cafe as well as the Latin Quarter. The staff were polite, helpful and not reluctant to converse in English at all. As we wanted to take it easy and have the weekend in paris this was perfect. Decor is a bit dated, there were insects at night if leave your window open (so keep that in mind). For us, this is a no hassle hotel which enabled us to relax, forgoet abt the rest and just enjoy Paris. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing gem of a hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: skd1305
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not part of our travel plan. However, we had our passports stolen while in the south of France and had to return to Paris to go to our embassy to get them replaced. We just made a last minute booking without reading any reviews so were a little nervous. When we got there we were so pleasantly surprised and happy. This hotel was a great find and is truly a hidden gem. It seems like it recently renovated as everything was very stylishly done and brand new. After our horrible ordeal we needed this. We had one double room and a deluxe triple room. The rooms were more spacious, had more amenities and were cheaper than most other Paris hotels we had stayed at. I truly believe the hotel deserves more than a 3 star rating. It is extremely well located with access to all sites, parking nearby, restaurants, metro - basically everything you could want at a reasonable price by Paris standards. Most of the staff spoke english and were very helpful. I'd recommend it to anyone and stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon, great location, great time in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: viper33
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, on a quiet street close to the Champs Elysees. We went on our honeymoon to Paris, and we stayed here all 5 nights. Pretty small, don't expect big space.. no one bothers you, pretty private. No complaints, however, if you choose to stay there make sure you get a room that's not directly facing the French Mixed School. This is a school of kids from 5-9 who are the loudest monsters on earth. Think screaming monsters at 7am morning, then again at 10 am recess, then again at 12 noon for lunch then again at 2pm recess then again at 3 when they're let out. yup. screaming x 5. Almost cute. Woke us up for a productive day though. Definitely recommend this hotel. Heard there's a nice quieter side of it too.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, friendly staff, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: TCavs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alison for two nights. The hotel is located on a sidestreet five minutes from Madeleine Metro station and 10 minutes from the Champs Elysees/Concorde. Our room was small and overlooked the street rather than the courtyard at the back of the hotel. Despite this, the room was probably the quietest I have ever stayed in - this may have been because it was the weekend and the nearby school and office buildings were obviously not being used. We didn't bother with breakfast so cannot comment. There is a supermarket pretty much opposite the hotel that meant we didn't need to go anywhere near the minibar. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the reception area is smart and clean. In short, this place is recommended for anyone who wishes to stay centrally, doesn't want to break the bank, can put up with small rooms and enjoys a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: vacay2vacay
Reviews.Content: A small hotel in a small street. We booked and communicated via e-mail and the staff was very responsive to our questions prior to our arrival. My husband and I traveled with my parents and sister. Our room was small. The bathroom was a little outdated. However the room was neat and clean. We had a room with big windows facing the street on 2nd floor, which we kept open during the night. It was quite noisy in the morning during school hours since there is a school right across the narrow street. However, it can be amusing to watch the local school children. And the big window with red geraniums at the bottom of your windowsills can be very charming. My parents and sister booked the triple, which is on the ground floor with a small courtyard that's charming and quiet. This hotel has great location, with lots of landmarks around. It took us about 30 mins to walk to Rue de Rivoli to meet up a tour to the Versailles. We managed to squeeze in a little breakfast of freshly baked croissants and espresso in a nearby cafe before the tour. Later after freshening up at the hotel, it took us only a short walk to the fabulous shopping avenue of Faubourg St. Honore. The hotel is near governmental buildings, that there were police/security around, so we felt very safe. There is also a small supermarket for sundries and checking out local products. The hotel is near the Madeleine metro station, where we took to go to Montmarte. That's the only time we used the metro as we walked most of the time (taxi for the parents). We also took a taxi to Gare du Nord on our way to London. On our last night, we wanted to savor the last moments in Paris by walking from Champs-Elysees back to the hotel (+/-30 mins). On the way, as we passed through Place de la Concorde, we caught the sparkling lights of The Eiffel Tower. One of best memories of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: DeFlooda
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Alison and it was great. Staff was very helpful, it was clean, quiet and cool even in August - great place to sleep off the jet lag. Walk of about 10 minutes to the metro which wasn't bad in the morning, but felt long after a day of sightseeing. Don't bother with the breakfast, there are cafes everywhere (right on the place de madeline) to get coffee and a market about a half a block away where you can grab water, snacks and wine for a picnic in the Tuileries or on the Seine. The price was very reasonable considering the location. definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel into a perfect city”
Reviews.Author: daniela2208
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We had a very pleasant and charming stay Daniela

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a posh location”
Reviews.Author: Overstone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a street behind the famous Faubourg St Honoré with its top designer brands and antique shops so consequently it's not a cheap area and although the Alison is a modest place the room prices rather reflect the area. As with so many Paris hotels the rooms are on the small side and in this case the bathroom was downright cramped. That is the downside, the upside is that for central Paris this hotel is remarkably quiet and my bed was blissfully comfortable. Another plus is that Madeleine Metro station is just a couple of minutes walk away and the Opera, the district I consider the centre of the city, is no more than a ten minute walk. I'm looking forward to staying at the Alison again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RRP268
Reviews.Content: Hotel was small, but it seems many in Paris are. Room had nice decor. No air-conditioning, but that again seems common for Paris. Staff was friendly and helpful. Quiet street near government buildings so there is always a police presence. My wife and I liked the location of the hotel... it is very close to the Madeline... we were in Paris 5 days, and it wasn't till the very end of our trip that we used the subway at all. The Louvre was a significant walk, and Notre Dame was a long walk (as was the Arche), Eiffel Tower was a significant walk, but nothing that we couldn't handle, and we liked walking through Paris. Breakfast is definitely not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: droen7
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Would recommend quad room for 2 adults and 2 teenagers - it was actually 2 separate rooms with adjoining hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trésor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nites in middle of September. Cost 80 euros a nite for single room (with shower). continental breakfast additional 9 euros. The bedroom was small but enough for my petite size. Location was near metro, british high commission, L'Elysée, office of Interior Minister etc. So you can see military police around this area which makes you feel safe. There is a small Franprix supermarché opposite the hotel and some restaurants nearby. Overall experience in this hotel was average. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDaviesFamily
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is ideally located for exploring the sights of Paris. It is located very near the Madeleine, less than 5min walk from the Madeleine Metro station. The hotel is within walking distance of the Place de la Concorde and the Rue de Rivoli leading down to the Louvre. Also, the airport bus stop and the Opera district with the large department stores are only a short walk away. The British Embassy is located between the hotel and the Madeleine and therefore there are police outside 24hrs a day which does make you feel very safe walking down the quiet street to the hotel. The problem with the location is that the hotel is in a very quiet, exclusive area with expensive designer shops & restaurants which are beyond the budget of the average tourist. If I was to visit Paris again, I would stay in the Latin Quarter (near the Notre Dame) where restaurants are much more reasonable and there is a busier atmosphere. Hotel: We stayed in the hotel's triple room which had a 'garden' view. In reality, this meant a tiny patio with a few potted plants and no roof, which meant that in order to leave our room, we had to use our umbrellas for the three steps to the hotel reception. The room was very clean and modern, and was nowhere near as small as some Parisien hotels. The room consisted of a double bed and a sofa bed. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. In conclusion, we had a very pleasant stay at the Hotel Alison, however its location was too quiet and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poinsettia
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with a superb location. The pros of this hotel are its location, location, location. The rooms are sparkling clean but a little small. The owners of the hotel are super nice, especially the young lady at the Front Desk. However, in the evening and weekends there is a slightly more grumpy man who is hired by the family--not as nice or helpful. The family themselves are absolute saints. Very safe because two heavily armed police guards with submachine guns are 100 ft away from the hotel at all times--I think they are guarding the back door to the British embassy. Overall, I recommend this hotel highly as long as you are not looking for a large room and it is not very hot in Paris, as there is no airconditioning and can get stuffy if it is warm outside.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: No problems with this average Parisian hotel, apart from the noisy lift which because the building is narow is audible all night. Made sleeping difficult. Maid was cleaning room next door and letting door slam at 7.45.- not appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Christmas holiday”
Reviews.Author: mowitt
Reviews.Content: It´s a very nice and quiet hotel - rigth in the middle og Paris. The breakfast were very good (cost extra). The room is very small, but clean and nice. We will recoment this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Overly satisfied, really impressed”
Reviews.Author: Suzzles20
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, really reasonable, rooms were clean and really quite comfortable. Staff very helpful also. Light b/fast in morning. Ideal for a up to a week stay. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!! we got really lucky with this one...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i had a GREAT time while in paris during the 2004 - 2005 new year and it was mainly in part to how lucky we got with this hotel. we made our reservations pretty late in the year and simply got... well... lucky. we didn't know what to expect but everything was perfect from the beginning 'til the end. to start off... the hotel is located in a great area. it is very close to the beautiful Champs Elysees (walking distance)... and... also about a 15-20 minute walk to the eifel tower or notre dame (hotel just about in the middle of both) then... there is a bank right down the street with an ATM (makes it very convenient to get money daily instead of carrying so much money to last you a few days)... there are also 2 metro stations very close to the hotel... and to top it off (as if THAT wasn't enough convenience) the hotel staff is absolutely BEAUTIFUL with the guests. i LOVED the treatment... they are polite, helpful, friendly, and honest. we left our luggage at the hotel for a week to backpack to london and when we came back everything was intact AND... they returned a cell phone to us that we had left in our room (we didn't even know it was missing). to sum it up... we DEFINATELY recommend this hotel to everyone. i'm sure we'll be going back too.

HotelInfo.Name: Alison Madeleine St. Honore Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 21, rue de Surene | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
